oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WWI veteran John Bowling's death certficate
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bowling died in the Veteran's Administration hospital at Mountain Home in Johnson City, and was buried in Knoxville at Lynnhurst Cemetery. His occupation is listed as fireman. His father was Charles D. Bowling and his mother Mary Graves. Pvt. Bowling served as a teamster in the 53rd Pioneer Brig. working on military engineering works in France. The document in GWmary025 cites his service in St. Mihiel and Argonne Forest from September 12 to Armistice Day, November 11, 1918.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
